metadata.title: ES6
metadata.intro: A quick reference cheatsheet of what's new in JavaScript for ES2015, ES2016, ES2017, ES2018 and beyond

cards.title: Block-scoped
Template Strings
cards.footer:
#### Interpolation

```js
const message = `Hello ${name}`;
```

#### Multi-line string

```js
const str = `
hello
the world
`;
```

Templates and multiline strings. See: [template strings](https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/#template-strings)

cards.title: Binary and octal literals
cards.footer: See: [Binary and Octal Literals](https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/#binary-and-octal-literals)

cards.title: Exponential Operator
New library additions
kind
Private class
make the commitment
Using Promises
cards.footer:
```js{2,3}
promise
  .then((result) => { ··· })
  .catch((error) => { ··· })
```

cards.title: Using Promises in finally
Async-await
Destructuring assignment
Defaults
Function parameters
cards.footer:
js
greet({ name: 'Larry', greeting: 'Ahoy' });
```
Destructuring of objects and arrays can also be done in function parameters

cards.title: Defaults
cards.footer:
js
greet(); // Hi Rauno!
greet({ name: 'Larry' }); // Hi Larry!
```

cards.title: Reassign keys
cards.footer:
js
printCoordinates({ left: 25, top: 90 });
```
This example assigns `x` to the value of the `left` key

cards.title: Loop
Object Deconstruction
Object Extensions
Array Expansion
cards.footer:
#### with array extension

```js{2,3}
const users = [
  ...admins,
  ...editors,
  'rstacruz'
]
```

#### No array expansion

```js
const users = admins.concat(editors).concat(['rstacruz']);
```

The spread operator allows you to build new arrays in the same way. See:
[Spread operator](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Spread_operator)

Imports import

`as` keyword renaming
Dynamically load modules
cards.footer: [ES2020 Proposal](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-dynamic-import) introduce `import()` function

subsections.title: import() allows module paths to be dynamically generated

cards.title: import() allows module paths to be dynamically generated
import.meta
cards.footer:
In the Node.js environment, `import.meta.url` always returns a local path, that is, a string of the `file:URL` protocol,
such as `file:/// home/user/foo.js`

cards.title: Import Assertions
Generator function
cards.footer:
```js
let gen = idMaker();
gen.next().value; // → 0
gen.next().value; // → 1
gen.next().value; // → 2
```
it's complicated. See: [Generators](https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/#generators)

cards.title: For..of + iterator
cards.footer: For iterating over generators and arrays. See: [For..of iteration](https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/#iterators--forof)

cards.title: Relationship with Iterator interface
cards.footer:
The `Generator` function is assigned to the `Symbol.iterator` property, so that the `gen` object has the `Iterator`
interface, which can be traversed by the `...` operator

cards.title: Symbol.iterator property
cards.footer:
`gen` is a `Generator` function, calling it will generate a traverser object `g`. Its `Symbol.iterator` property, which
is also an iterator object generation function, returns itself after execution
